newsitem.title: USA: Clinton urged to back home heating program.
newsitem.headline: Clinton urged to back home heating program.

text.p: President Clinton was urged Monday by 43 senators to reject any cuts in the $1 billion a year federal program that helps low income familes pay home heating costs.

The bipartisan group of senators from eastern and midwestern states said they were concerned by reports that the administration was considering cutting or phasing out the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP).
"We urge you, in the strongest terms possible, to reject this course of action," the senators told Clinton in a letter.

"LIHEAP is all that prevents many disadvantaged households from being forced to choose between heating or cooling their homes and putting food on the table," they said. The senators said prices for fuel oil, natural gas, propane and wood were all rising.
Clinton said at a news conference last Friday that he had no intention of slashing the program.
